inference:
The ant has 4 choices for vertex A, and 1 choice for vertex B. So the probability that vertex B will be the bottom vertex is $\frac{1}{4}$.
Final Answer: $\boxed{\frac{1}{4}}$. I hope it is correct.
ground_truth: Since the ant starts at the top vertex, his next destination, vertex A, is equally likely to be any of the 4 vertices along the middle ring. Each of these vertices is adjacent to 4 other vertices, and since they are in the middle, exactly 1 of those 4 vertices is the bottom vertex. So, regardless of which intermediate vertex he goes to, the ant will end up at the bottom vertex with $\boxed{\frac{1}{4}}$ probability, by the symmetry of the 4 intermediate stages.
